Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which President Abraham Lincoln enforced the Fugitive Slave Act until the Civil War ended.
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity of federal policy changes and enforcement of the Fugitive Slave Act during the Civil War.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient evidence or support to fully substantiate the assertion that Lincoln enforced the Fugitive Slave Act until the Civil War ended.
Problematic assumption: The claim may make an assumption that Lincoln's enforcement of the Fugitive Slave Act continued throughout the entire duration of the Civil War, which may be problematic due to changing federal policies and circumstances.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors that influenced the enforcement of the Fugitive Slave Act during the Civil War, which are not fully addressed in the claim.
